title: Break Game Spec into Epics and Issues
description:
## Overview
Break the game specification into a structured set of epics and issues that Ralph can work through.

## What To Do

1. **Read the spec** at docs/specs/game-spec.md thoroughly

2. **Create epics** for each major feature area:
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Core Game Engine" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Weapons System" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "AI Opponents" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Visual Effects" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "Audio System" ...`
   - `bd create --type epic --title "UI/Menus" ...`
   - etc.

3. **Break each epic into small, focused issues:**
   - Each issue = ONE thing Ralph can do in ONE iteration
   - Too big? Split it. "Implement all weapons" → one issue per weapon
   - Example issues under Core Game Engine:
     - "Create game loop and state machine"
     - "Implement turn system"
     - "Add projectile trajectory calculation"
     - "Implement terrain heightmap data structure"
     - "Add terrain rendering"
     - "Implement collision detection"
     - "Add terrain destruction"

4. **CRITICAL: Set dependencies correctly:**
   - ALL implementation issues must include: `--deps "blocks:scorched-earth-7ku"`
   - This ensures tech stack is done first
   - Also set logical dependencies (terrain rendering blocks terrain destruction)

5. **Write good acceptance criteria for EACH issue:**
   ```bash
   bd create --title "Implement basic projectile physics" \
     --type task \
     --parent <epic-id> \
     --deps "blocks:scorched-earth-7ku" \
     --acceptance "## Acceptance Criteria
   - [ ] Projectile spawns at tank barrel position
   - [ ] Follows parabolic arc based on angle and power
   - [ ] Affected by gravity constant
   - [ ] Affected by wind value
   - [ ] Trajectory visually matches expected physics
   - [ ] Console shows no errors"
   ```

6. **Prioritize logically:**
   - Foundation first (game loop, rendering, physics)
   - Then features (weapons, AI)
   - Then polish (effects, audio, UI)

7. **Document the structure** - Update CLAUDE.md "Current Status" section with the epic breakdown
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [x] Create epics for major feature areas (Core Engine, Weapons, AI, UI, Audio, etc.)
- [x] Break each epic into implementable issues
- [x] Each issue has clear, testable acceptance criteria
- [x] Issues are properly sized for Ralph (one issue = one iteration)
- [x] Dependencies between issues are documented
- [x] All issues link back to parent epics
- [x] **CRITICAL: ALL implementation issues must be blocked by scorched-earth-7ku (tech stack epic)**
- [x] No implementation work can start until tech stack is complete

This ensures tech stack is fully set up before any game code is written.
notes:
## Implementation Summary

Created comprehensive epic and issue breakdown for Synthwave Scorched Earth.

### Epics Created (11 total)

1. **Core Game Engine** (scorched-earth-5zm) - 6 issues
   - Canvas setup, game loop, state machine, turn system, input abstraction, asset loader

2. **Terrain System** (scorched-earth-v3c) - 6 issues
   - Heightmap, generation, rendering, destruction, tank placement, falling dirt

3. **Tank and Projectile Physics** (scorched-earth-wu8) - 8 issues
   - Tank entity, rendering, projectile physics/rendering, collision, damage, wind

4. **Weapons System** (scorched-earth-8qc) - 9 issues
   - Weapon registry, Basic Shot, Missile/Big Shot, MIRV, Death's Head, Rollers, Diggers, Nukes, selection

5. **AI Opponents** (scorched-earth-7hv) - 5 issues
   - Easy/Medium/Hard AI, turn execution, difficulty progression

6. **Visual Effects** (scorched-earth-qff) - 5 issues
   - Particles, screen shake, flash, synthwave backgrounds, CRT effects

7. **Audio System** (scorched-earth-cu2) - 5 issues
   - Web Audio setup, SFX, music, volume controls, ducking

8. **UI and Menus** (scorched-earth-x47) - 6 issues
   - Main menu, HUD, aiming controls, turn indicator, victory/defeat, pause menu

9. **Economy and Shop** (scorched-earth-wzf) - 5 issues
   - Money system, shop UI, purchasing, inventory, round progression

10. **Mobile Support** (scorched-earth-pxn) - 5 issues
    - Touch aiming, responsive scaling, touch UI, Capacitor, Safari testing

### Total Statistics
- 11 epics (including pre-existing tech stack epic)
- 60+ implementation tasks
- All P1 core gameplay issues
- P2 polish issues (effects, audio, mobile)
- P3 nice-to-have issues (CRT effects, volume ducking, Capacitor)

### Dependency Chain
Tech Stack → Core Engine → Terrain/Tank → Weapons → AI → Shop

### Files Modified

title: Write Game Specification for Synthwave Scorched Earth
description:
## Overview
Write a comprehensive game specification for Synthwave Scorched Earth based on the research findings.

## What To Do

1. **Read the research document** at docs/research/scorched-earth-original.md thoroughly

2. **Create the spec document** at docs/specs/game-spec.md with these sections:

### Core Gameplay
- Turn structure (player turn → AI turn → repeat)
- Win/lose conditions
- Round progression
- How damage is calculated

### Controls & Input
- Aiming mechanism (angle: 0-180°, power: 0-100%)
- Touch input mapping for mobile (drag to aim, release to fire)
- Keyboard fallbacks for desktop

### Physics System
- Projectile motion equations (gravity, initial velocity, wind)
- Wind behavior (constant per round? variable?)
- Collision detection with terrain
- Terrain destruction radius calculations

### Weapons
For EACH weapon, define:
- Name, cost, ammo limit
- Damage value and blast radius
- Special behavior (MIRV splits, Roller rolls, Digger burrows)
- Visual effect type

### Terrain System
- Generation algorithm (midpoint displacement? perlin noise?)
- Destruction mechanics (how craters form)
- Dirt falling physics (how displaced terrain settles)
- Terrain data structure (heightmap array)

### Economy & Progression
- Starting money
- Money earned per hit/kill/win
- Shop items and prices
- Round difficulty scaling

### AI Opponents
- Difficulty tiers (Easy, Medium, Hard)
- How AI calculates shots
- AI weapon selection logic

### Visual Design (Synthwave)
- Color palette (neons, dark backgrounds, grid lines)
- Tank designs
- Explosion effects
- UI style
- Background layers (sunset gradient, grid, mountains)

### Audio Design
- Music style (synthwave, 80s)
- Sound effects needed (shot, explosion, menu, win/lose)

### Asset List
- List every sprite needed with dimensions
- Reference the asset architecture in CLAUDE.md

3. **Be specific** - Ralph will use this spec to create issues. Vague specs = vague issues.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [x] Define core gameplay mechanics (turns, aiming, firing)
- [x] Define complete weapon system with stats and behaviors
- [x] Define physics requirements (gravity, wind, collision)
- [x] Define terrain generation and destruction specs
- [x] Define UI/UX design with synthwave aesthetic
- [x] Define sound design direction (80s synthwave, Dr Disrespect style)
- [x] Define progression/economy system
- [x] Document mobile (iOS) considerations
- [x] Define AI opponent behavior tiers
- [x] **Define asset architecture for swappable sprites (see CLAUDE.md)**
- [x] **Specify all sprite types needed (tanks, projectiles, effects, UI, backgrounds)**
- [x] Spec delivered in docs/specs/game-spec.md
notes:
## Implementation Summary

Created comprehensive game specification document at docs/specs/game-spec.md based on the original Scorched Earth research.

### Spec Contents

1. **Core Gameplay** - Complete turn structure diagram, win/lose conditions, damage calculation formulas with direct hit bonus
2. **Controls & Input** - Desktop keyboard/mouse controls, mobile gesture-based aiming (Angry Birds style), input abstraction layer for cross-platform
3. **Physics System** - Projectile motion equations, wind system, collision detection algorithms for terrain and tanks
4. **Weapons System** - 11 weapons across 5 categories (Standard, Splitting, Rolling, Digging, Nuclear) with full stats, costs, and behavior descriptions including MIRV split mechanics and Roller/Digger special behaviors
5. **Terrain System** - Midpoint displacement generation algorithm, heightmap data structure, destruction mechanics, falling dirt physics
6. **Economy & Progression** - Starting resources, money earning formula, round progression with AI difficulty scaling, shop system
7. **AI Opponents** - Three difficulty tiers (Easy, Medium, Hard) with specific accuracy, wind compensation, and weapon selection behaviors with pseudocode
8. **Visual Design** - Complete synthwave color palette, 10-layer visual composition, tank/explosion designs, UI style guide, optional CRT effects
9. **Audio Design** - Sound effect list with durations, music states, volume ducking system
10. **Asset Specifications** - Full manifest.json schema, sprite dimensions for all assets, placeholder rendering strategy
11. **Mobile (iOS) Considerations** - Screen sizing for various devices, canvas scaling, touch handling, performance targets, Capacitor config

### Key Design Decisions

- Gesture-based mobile aiming inspired by Angry Birds
- Simplified weapon set (11 vs original 30+) for V1
- Linear damage falloff with 1.5x direct hit multiplier
- 3-tier AI with clear differentiation
- Programmatic placeholder system allowing art replacement without code changes

### Files Created
- docs/specs/game-spec.md - Complete game specification (1200+ lines)

## Implementation Summary

Created 16 issues under the tech stack epic (scorched-earth-7ku) covering all foundational setup.

### Issue Breakdown

**Project Setup (5 issues):**
- 7ku.1 - Create index.html with Canvas and Basic Structure
- 7ku.2 - Set Up CSS with Synthwave Color Variables
- 7ku.3 - Create JavaScript Module Structure
- 7ku.4 - Set Up Asset Directory and Manifest Structure
- 7ku.5 - Implement Constants Module with Game Settings

**Rendering Setup (3 issues):**

title: Core Game Engine
description:
## Overview
Foundation of the game including canvas setup, game loop, state machine, and basic rendering infrastructure.

## Scope
- HTML5 Canvas initialization and responsive sizing
- Game loop with consistent frame timing
- Game state machine (menu, playing, shop, victory, defeat)
- Turn system (player turn → projectile resolution → AI turn)
- Input abstraction layer for cross-platform support
- Asset loading system

## Dependencies
- Blocked by: scorched-earth-7ku (tech stack setup)
- Blocks: All other epics depend on core engine

title: Create HTML5 Canvas and Responsive Sizing
description: Set up the main game canvas with responsive sizing that works across desktop and mobile devices.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] index.html contains canvas element with id 'game'
- [ ] Canvas scales to fit viewport while maintaining aspect ratio
- [ ] Handles devicePixelRatio for crisp rendering on high-DPI displays
- [ ] Window resize handler updates canvas dimensions
- [ ] Design resolution is 1200x800 (scaled appropriately)
- [ ] Canvas background is synthwave dark (#0a0a1a)
- [ ] No console errors

title: Implement Game Loop with Fixed Timestep
description: Create the main game loop using requestAnimationFrame with consistent frame timing for physics.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Game loop runs at 60fps target using requestAnimationFrame
- [ ] Fixed timestep for physics updates (separate from render)
- [ ] Delta time calculated correctly
- [ ] Loop can be paused/resumed
- [ ] Frame rate counter visible in debug mode
- [ ] No physics jitter or stuttering
- [ ] Console shows 'Game loop started' on init

title: Create Game State Machine
description: Implement state machine to manage game states: menu, playing, shop, victory, defeat.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] GameState enum with: MENU, PLAYING, SHOP, VICTORY, DEFEAT
- [ ] State transitions are clean with enter/exit hooks
- [ ] Each state has its own update() and render() methods
- [ ] State can be queried from anywhere via game.state
- [ ] Transition from MENU to PLAYING works on 'Start Game'
- [ ] Console logs state transitions in debug mode
- [ ] No invalid state transitions possible

title: Implement Turn System
description: Create the turn-based system that alternates between player and AI, with projectile resolution between turns.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Turn phases: PLAYER_AIM, PLAYER_FIRE, PROJECTILE_FLIGHT, AI_AIM, AI_FIRE
- [ ] Player can only aim/fire during PLAYER_AIM phase
- [ ] Projectile phase waits for projectile to resolve (hit or off-screen)
- [ ] AI turn begins after projectile resolution
- [ ] Turn indicator shows whose turn it is
- [ ] Turn transitions are smooth with no stuck states
- [ ] Console logs turn changes in debug mode

title: Create Input Abstraction Layer
description: Build input abstraction that handles both keyboard/mouse (desktop) and touch (mobile) inputs uniformly.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Input events: ANGLE_CHANGE, POWER_CHANGE, FIRE, SELECT_WEAPON
- [ ] Keyboard: Arrow keys for angle/power, Space to fire, Tab for weapon
- [ ] Mouse: Click and drag on sliders
- [ ] Touch: Touch and drag gesture (to be refined in mobile epic)
- [ ] Input is queued and processed once per frame
- [ ] Input disabled during non-player phases
- [ ] All inputs work without console errors

title: Implement Asset Loader
description: Create asset loading system that reads manifest.json and loads all images/audio with progress tracking.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Reads assets/manifest.json for asset definitions
- [ ] Loads all images as Image objects
- [ ] Loading progress percentage available
- [ ] Callback/promise when all assets loaded
- [ ] Graceful handling of missing assets (use placeholders)
- [ ] Assets accessible via AssetManager.get('tanks.player')
- [ ] Console shows loading progress
- [ ] No errors when manifest or assets are missing (falls back to placeholders)

title: AI Opponents
description:
## Overview
AI opponents with three difficulty tiers that calculate shots and select weapons strategically.

## Scope
- Easy AI (random with large error)
- Medium AI (basic trajectory calculation, partial wind compensation)
- Hard AI (accurate calculation, full wind compensation, strategic weapon selection)
- AI turn execution with timing/animation
- AI difficulty progression by round

## Dependencies
- Blocked by: Tank and Projectile Physics, Weapons System
- Blocks: Nothing (end of core gameplay chain)

title: Implement Easy AI
description: Create Easy AI that aims at player with large random error and no wind compensation.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Calculates angle to player (direct line)
- [ ] Adds random error: ±15° angle, ±20% power
- [ ] No wind compensation
- [ ] Only uses Basic Shot weapon
- [ ] Shot usually misses but sometimes gets close
- [ ] Provides low challenge for new players
- [ ] AI thinking delay: 1-2 seconds
- [ ] Console logs AI decision in debug mode

title: Implement Medium AI
description: Create Medium AI with basic ballistic calculation and partial wind compensation.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Calculates ballistic arc to reach player
- [ ] Accounts for gravity in trajectory
- [ ] Partial wind compensation (50% correction)
- [ ] Random error: ±8° angle, ±10% power
- [ ] Uses Missiles and Rollers when available
- [ ] Often lands close to player
- [ ] Moderate challenge for experienced players
- [ ] Weapon selection: 50% chance to use better weapon if available

title: Implement Hard AI
description: Create Hard AI with accurate calculation, full wind compensation, and strategic weapon selection.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Uses iterative solver for accurate trajectory
- [ ] Full wind compensation
- [ ] Small random error: ±3° angle, ±5% power
- [ ] Checks if terrain blocks shot, adjusts arc if needed
- [ ] Strategic weapon selection:
  - [ ] Roller if player in valley
  - [ ] Digger if terrain blocks shot
  - [ ] MIRV/Death's Head for area damage
- [ ] High hit rate (60-80% of shots deal damage)
- [ ] Provides real challenge

title: Implement AI Turn Execution
description: Execute AI turn with thinking delay and optional aim animation for player feedback.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Show 'AI Thinking...' indicator during AI turn
- [ ] 1-2 second delay before AI fires (dramatic tension)
- [ ] Optional: animate turret rotation to final angle
- [ ] Optional: animate power bar adjustment
- [ ] Fire projectile after delay
- [ ] Hide thinking indicator
- [ ] Return control to player after projectile resolves
- [ ] Works with all AI difficulty levels

title: Implement AI Difficulty Progression
description: Scale AI difficulty based on round number for progressive challenge.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Rounds 1-2: Easy AI
- [ ] Rounds 3-4: Medium AI
- [ ] Rounds 5+: Hard AI
- [ ] getAIDifficulty(roundNumber) returns difficulty
- [ ] AI purchases weapons between rounds (based on difficulty)
- [ ] Higher difficulty AI has better weapon inventory
- [ ] Difficulty shown in UI somewhere (optional)

title: Set Up Tech Stack and Project Scaffolding
description:
## Overview
This epic contains all foundational tech setup that must be complete before game implementation begins.

## Purpose
Every game implementation issue is blocked by this epic. Once all children of this epic are complete, the floodgates open and Ralph can start building the actual game.

## What This Epic Covers

### Project Foundation
- index.html with properly sized canvas
- CSS with synthwave theme variables
- JavaScript ES module structure
- Asset manifest and loader system

### Rendering System
- Canvas 2D context initialization
- Responsive canvas sizing
- Game render loop (requestAnimationFrame)
- Retina/high-DPI support

### Input System
- Abstraction layer supporting both mouse and touch
- Input state tracking (position, pressed, released)
- Mobile-friendly touch handling

### Audio System
- Web Audio API setup
- Sound effect playback
- Background music with looping
- Volume control

### Game Loop
- State machine (menu → playing → shop → game-over)
- Fixed timestep update loop
- Delta time handling

## Completion Criteria
This epic is complete when:
- The game loads in browser without errors
- Canvas renders and resizes correctly
- Input works on both desktop and mobile
- Audio plays
- Game loop runs with state transitions
- All child issues are closed

## Children
Issues will be created by scorched-earth-4b4 (Break Tech Stack Epic into Issues)
acceptance_criteria:

### Rendering
- [ ] Evaluate Canvas 2D vs PixiJS (WebGL) for rendering
- [ ] Consider particle effects needs (explosions, debris)

### Physics

- [ ] Document projectile trajectory math
- [ ] Document terrain destruction approach

### Mobile/iOS Strategy

### Project Setup

### Documentation

NOTE: This epic will be broken into bite-sized issues by scorched-earth-4b4

title: Implement Keyboard Input Handling
description: Add keyboard input handling to input.js for desktop controls (arrows, space, tab).
acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] Track keys currently pressed
- [ ] isKeyDown(keyCode) function
- [ ] wasKeyPressed(keyCode) for single-fire events

title: Set Up Web Audio API Context and Sound Manager
description: Create js/sound.js with Web Audio API initialization and basic sound management structure.
acceptance_criteria:

- [ ] init() function to initialize on user interaction
- [ ] isInitialized() function to check state

title: Implement Sound Effect Player
description: Add ability to load and play sound effects through the sound manager.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] loadSound(id, path) loads audio file
- [ ] playSound(id) plays loaded sound
- [ ] Sounds play through SFX gain node
- [ ] Can play same sound overlapping
- [ ] Handle missing audio files gracefully
- [ ] Sounds stored in cache for reuse
- [ ] Volume respects SFX gain setting
- [ ] Test: placeholder sound plays without error

title: Implement Music Player with Loop Support
description: Add ability to play background music tracks with loop and crossfade support.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] loadMusic(id, path) loads music file
- [ ] playMusic(id, loop=true) plays music
- [ ] stopMusic() stops current track
- [ ] Only one music track plays at a time
- [ ] Music loops seamlessly by default
- [ ] Music plays through music gain node
- [ ] Can fade between tracks (optional)
- [ ] Test: placeholder music loops without gap

title: Create Basic Game State Machine
description: Implement js/game.js with state machine for game states (MENU, PLAYING, SHOP, VICTORY, DEFEAT).
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] GameState enum: MENU, PLAYING, SHOP, VICTORY, DEFEAT
- [ ] Current state tracked in module
- [ ] setState(newState) with validation
- [ ] getState() returns current state
- [ ] State-specific update and render functions
- [ ] onEnter/onExit hooks for state transitions
- [ ] Game starts in MENU state
- [ ] Log state transitions in debug mode

title: Add Debug Mode with FPS Counter
description: Add debug mode toggle that shows FPS counter and enables debug logging.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] DEBUG constant in constants.js (default: true for dev)
- [ ] FPS counter displayed on canvas when debug on
- [ ] FPS calculated as rolling average
- [ ] Debug messages only log when DEBUG is true
- [ ] Can toggle debug with 'D' key (optional)
- [ ] FPS counter positioned in corner, doesn't obstruct gameplay
- [ ] Shows ms per frame in addition to FPS
- [ ] Test: FPS counter shows ~60 on modern hardware

title: Create Asset Loader Module
description: Create js/assets.js that loads images from manifest.json and provides access to loaded assets.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] js/assets.js created
- [ ] loadManifest() fetches and parses assets/manifest.json
- [ ] loadAllAssets() loads all images in manifest
- [ ] get(path) returns loaded image (e.g., get('tanks.player'))
- [ ] Loading progress callback/promise
- [ ] Handles missing images gracefully (returns null or placeholder)

notes:
## Implementation Summary

Comprehensive research on the original Scorched Earth (1991) DOS game has been completed and documented.

### Key Findings

**Weapons System:**
- 30+ weapons across 4 categories (Standard, Earth-Destroying, Earth-Producing, Energy)
- Complete pricing and bundle size information documented
- Special mechanics: MIRV splits mid-flight, Rollers follow slopes, Sandhogs tunnel under shields

**Physics:**
- 2D ballistic trajectory with configurable gravity, wind, and air viscosity
- Wall behaviors: Bounce, Wrap, Absorb, Concrete
- Fixed interval trajectory updates for CPU-independent physics

**Terrain:**
- Heightmap-based destructible terrain
- Falling dirt physics with suspend probability setting
- Burial mechanic forces tanks to shoot themselves free

**Economy:**
- Bundle-based purchasing with interest on unspent money
- Three scoring modes: BASIC, STANDARD, GREEDY
- Free market mode with supply/demand pricing

**AI:**
- 7 distinct AI levels from Moron to Cyborg
- Higher AIs account for wind, gravity, even target prioritization

**Controls:**
- Arrow keys for angle/power, Space/Enter to fire
- Tank panel (T) for equipment management
- Documented all keyboard shortcuts

**Mobile Considerations:**
- Gesture-based aiming recommended (drag to set angle/power like Angry Birds)
- Landscape orientation preferred (matches original horizontal battlefield)
- Simultaneous mode impractical for single device
- Touch-specific opportunities: pinch-to-zoom, haptic feedback

### Files Created
- docs/research/scorched-earth-original.md (609 lines, ~19KB)

### Sources
Research compiled from Abandonware DOS manual, MobyGames, ClassicReload, The Cutting Room Floor, and other authoritative sources.

## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] checkTerrainCollision(x, y) returns hit info
- [ ] Collision when y >= terrain[x] (projectile at or below ground)
- [ ] Returns collision point (x, y)
- [ ] Handles projectiles outside terrain bounds (off-screen)
- [ ] Sub-pixel accuracy not required (integer positions OK)
- [ ] Collision check runs each physics frame
- [ ] No false positives at terrain edges

title: Implement Tank Collision Detection
description: Detect when projectile collides with a tank using rectangular hitbox.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] checkTankCollision(x, y, tanks) returns hit tank or null
- [ ] Tank hitbox is rectangular (64x32 centered on tank position)
- [ ] Direct hit flag if projectile center within 5px of tank center
- [ ] Check both player and enemy tanks
- [ ] Collision returns which tank was hit
- [ ] Works correctly when tanks overlap (edge case)
- [ ] No collision with already-destroyed tanks

title: Implement Damage Calculation
description: Calculate damage to tanks based on explosion proximity with distance falloff.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] calculateDamage(explosion, tank, weapon) returns damage amount
- [ ] Damage based on distance from explosion center
- [ ] Linear falloff: damage = maxDamage * (1 - distance/blastRadius)
- [ ] Zero damage outside blast radius
- [ ] 1.5x multiplier for direct hits (distance < 5px)
- [ ] Damage applied to tank health
- [ ] Console logs damage dealt in debug mode

title: Implement Wind System
description: Add wind that affects projectile trajectory, randomized each round.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Wind value range: -10 to +10
- [ ] Negative = blowing left, Positive = blowing right
- [ ] New random wind value each round
- [ ] Wind affects projectile horizontal velocity each frame
- [ ] Wind indicator UI shows direction and strength
- [ ] Wind visually represented (arrow with variable size)
- [ ] Projectile trajectory visibly affected by wind

title: Economy and Shop
description:
## Overview
Money system and weapon shop between rounds for progression.

## Scope
- Money earning from damage/kills/wins
- Shop UI for purchasing weapons
- Player inventory management
- Round progression with difficulty scaling

## Dependencies
- Blocked by: Core Game Engine, Weapons System
- Blocks: Complete game loop experience

title: Implement Money System
description: Track player money, award based on damage dealt and round outcome.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Player starts with 
- [ ] Earn  + (damage × 2) for each hit
- [ ] Earn  for winning round
- [ ] Earn  for losing round (consolation)
- [ ] Money persists across rounds
- [ ] Money displayed in HUD
- [ ] Money earned shown in victory/defeat screen
- [ ] Console logs money changes in debug mode

title: Create Shop UI
description: Build weapon shop interface showing all weapons with prices and purchase buttons.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Shop opens after victory/defeat screen
- [ ] Shows all weapons organized by category
- [ ] Each weapon shows: name, cost, current ammo, damage, radius
- [ ] Buy button for each weapon
- [ ] Current balance displayed prominently
- [ ] Can't buy if insufficient funds (button disabled)
- [ ] Synthwave styling (neon borders, dark panels)
- [ ] 'Done' button to start next round

title: Implement Weapon Purchasing
description: Allow player to buy weapons, deduct money, add to inventory.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Click buy deducts weapon cost from balance
- [ ] Adds ammo to player inventory
- [ ] Each purchase adds weapon's ammo amount
- [ ] Can buy same weapon multiple times
- [ ] Purchase sound effect plays
- [ ] Balance updates immediately
- [ ] Inventory updates immediately
- [ ] Console logs purchases in debug mode

title: Implement Player Inventory
description: Track player's weapon inventory with ammo counts.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Inventory object: { weaponId: ammoCount }
- [ ] Basic Shot always available (Infinity ammo)
- [ ] Ammo decremented when weapon fired
- [ ] Weapon unavailable when ammo = 0
- [ ] Inventory shown in weapon selection UI
- [ ] getAvailableWeapons() returns weapons with ammo > 0
- [ ] Inventory persists across rounds
- [ ] Inventory can be viewed in shop

title: Implement Round Progression
description: Progress through rounds with increasing difficulty and bonus multipliers.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Track current round number
- [ ] Rounds 1-2: Easy AI, 1.0x money bonus
- [ ] Rounds 3-4: Medium AI, 1.2x money bonus
- [ ] Rounds 5+: Hard AI, 1.5x money bonus
- [ ] New terrain generated each round
- [ ] New wind value each round
- [ ] Tanks reset to full health
- [ ] Round number displayed in HUD
- [ ] No max round limit (endless progression)

title: UI and Menus
description:
## Overview
All user interface elements including HUD, main menu, and in-game controls.

## Scope
- Main menu screen
- In-game HUD (health, angle, power, wind, weapon)
- Aiming controls (sliders/indicators)
- Turn indicator
- Victory/defeat screens
- Pause menu

## Dependencies
- Blocked by: Core Game Engine
- Blocks: Full playable experience

title: Create Main Menu Screen
description: Create main menu with synthwave styling: title, start game button, options.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Full-screen menu overlay
- [ ] Game title with neon text effect
- [ ] 'Start Game' button
- [ ] 'Options' button (can be disabled for V1)
- [ ] Synthwave background visible behind menu
- [ ] Neon borders and glow effects
- [ ] Click/tap on Start begins game
- [ ] Menu transitions smoothly to gameplay

title: Implement In-Game HUD
description: Create heads-up display showing health, angle, power, wind, and current weapon.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Health bars for player and enemy (positioned near tanks or top of screen)
- [ ] Current angle display (numeric: 45°)
- [ ] Current power display (bar or numeric: 80%)
- [ ] Wind indicator (arrow showing direction/strength)
- [ ] Current weapon name and ammo count
- [ ] Money display
- [ ] HUD uses synthwave styling (neon, dark panels)
- [ ] HUD doesn't obscure gameplay area
- [ ] All values update in real-time

title: Create Aiming Controls UI
description: Visual controls for adjusting angle and power: arc indicator, power bar, fire button.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Angle indicator: arc or radial display around tank
- [ ] Power bar: vertical or horizontal slider
- [ ] Fire button: large, prominent, neon styled
- [ ] Controls update in real-time with input
- [ ] Trajectory preview line (optional: dotted line showing path)
- [ ] Controls only active during player turn
- [ ] Touch-friendly sizing for mobile
- [ ] Keyboard still works alongside visual controls

title: Implement Turn Indicator
description: Show whose turn it is and current turn phase (aiming, firing, AI thinking).
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] 'YOUR TURN' indicator during player phase
- [ ] 'AI THINKING...' indicator during AI phase
- [ ] 'PROJECTILE IN FLIGHT' during resolution (optional)
- [ ] Indicator prominent but not blocking gameplay
- [ ] Neon text styling
- [ ] Smooth transitions between indicators
- [ ] Positioned at top-center or similar visible location

title: Create Victory and Defeat Screens
description: Show victory or defeat overlay when round ends with option to continue or quit.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] 'VICTORY' screen when enemy destroyed
- [ ] 'DEFEAT' screen when player destroyed
- [ ] Show money earned this round
- [ ] 'Continue to Shop' button (leads to shop)
- [ ] 'Quit to Menu' button
- [ ] Dramatic synthwave styling
- [ ] Optional: show damage dealt statistics
- [ ] Screen appears after short delay post-explosion

title: Implement Pause Menu
description: Add pause functionality with menu overlay during gameplay.
acceptance_criteria:
## Acceptance Criteria

- [ ] Escape key or pause button opens pause menu
- [ ] Game loop pauses (no updates)
- [ ] Dark overlay dims game behind menu
- [ ] 'Resume' button continues game
- [ ] 'Options' button (volume controls)
- [ ] 'Quit to Menu' button (with confirmation)
- [ ] Escape or tap outside closes menu
- [ ] Menu has synthwave styling
